cards.name: Harimau Malaya
facts: The Malayan tiger is critically endangered in the wild.
Tigers are strong swimmers and often cool down in water.
Each tiger has a unique stripe pattern.

cards.name: Gajah Asia
facts: Asian elephants use their trunk for breathing, feeding, and social touch.
Elephants can communicate over long distances using low-frequency sounds.
They play a key role in shaping forest ecosystems.

cards.name: Penguin
facts: Penguins are flightless birds built for swimming, not flying.
Dense feathers and body fat help penguins stay warm.
Many penguin species gather in large social colonies.
